title: Ticket #7061: Transferred files in subdirs from Win to *nix contain backslash
description:
A user on htcondor-admin reports that when transferring their working directory, which contains subdirectories, from a Windows submit machine to a Linux execute machine, files from the subdirectories end up in the root directory of the job sandbox with names in the format <subdirectory>\<filename>. From the ticket:

  What happens when using [transfer_input_files =] "./" is that a directory "a" is created, but instead of creating "test.txt" in "a", a file named "a\test.txt" is created,

It appears that we are not handling path separators quite right on Windows in this case.
